intro: Pleurothallis juergensii, commonly known as the Jürgens's orchid, is a species native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its small, intricate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and green. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on the surface of trees without deriving nutrients from them. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-draining substrates for optimal growth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is a sought-after species among orchid enthusiasts.
